unnormalised: Ferry services from Mumbai to Goa, suspended since, well, forever (or at least it feels like it), are FINALLY set to restart. unnormalised: Apparently, the hold-up was due to "technical difficulties" which is code for "we forgot Goa gets really choppy during monsoon." So, passengers can look forward to a scenic, if slightly delayed, journey along the Konkan coast. Tickets start from Rs. 7,000, but that doesn't include the mandatory seasickness bag or a calming cup of chai (bring your own, folks).
